All I’m sayin’ is, I don’t think that the mods should go around telling people they should leave… The way I see it is that their job is to punish people that break the rules, yes? So punish him, warn him, mute him, do whatever, I just personally don’t think that telling someone to leave because they’re breaking a few rules isn’t really going to help. Then again mods may have these rules they have to stick by, I don’t know. It’s probably not my place to say but meh.

item.description:

<T> boolean contains(Iterable<T> haystack, T needle) { for (T subject : haystack) { if (needle.equals(subject)) { return true; } } return false; }

generic linear search

item.title: If int[].contains? [Java]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

or make it mutatable

public boolean contain(Object[] src, Object value) { for(Object o : src) { if(o.equals(value)) { return true; } } return false; }

Read full topic

item.title: If int[].contains? [Java]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote="`Discardedx2, post:9, topic:394638"]Please take note of java.util.SortedMap and java.util.SortedSet guys

http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/SortedMap.html

http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/SortedSet.html[/quote]

Why would you purposely create all that over head just to find something in an int[]?

public boolean contains(int[] src, int value) {
    for (int i : src) {
        if (i == value) {
            return true;
        }
    }
    return false;
}

That’s literally all you have to do.

Read full topic
